elements.name: A10_context
elements.title: Task A10
elements.html:
Summarise

Original: Alex's work is greatly appreciated. He achieves at the level that is expected of him and complies with what is expected. He is a valuable asset to our team. I would like to see Alex to strive to go above and behind in his work. I believe that he has great potential to become a more critical component within the company. Alex can strive to improve his communication skills in specifically.

Blue Whale
Alex is a valuable asset who meets expectations. To realize his high potential, he should strive to exceed his duties and improve his communication skills.


Red Panda
Alex: Greatly appreciated, meets expectations, valuable asset. Needs to go above & beyond, improve communication.


Green Elephant
Alex is a valued, compliant team member. He meets expectations but should strive for excellence, especially in communication, to reach his full potential and become a more critical asset.


Golden Fish
Alex is a valued team member who meets expectations and contributes positively. He has strong potential to take on a more critical role. To grow further, he should aim to exceed expectations and improve his communication skills.

elements.name: A12_context
elements.title: Task A12
elements.html:
Summarise

Original: I have been so impessed with Frederick Rogers work at our company. Fred as he prefers to be called, outshines the competition every single day; he goes above and beyond what is expected of him. If Fred keeps doing what he has been I feel as he will be able to climb up in our infrastructure. He has been an outstanding employee and I'm so glad he works for our company!

Red Panda
Frederick is an outstanding employee who consistently exceeds expectations and outperforms others. His work shows high potential for advancement.


Golden Fish
Frederick: Outshines competition, goes above & beyond daily. Outstanding, will climb infrastructure. Glad he's here.


Green Elephant
Fred Rogers consistently exceeds expectations, demonstrating outstanding performance. His dedication and work ethic suggest strong potential for advancement within the company.


Blue Whale
Fred Rogers is an outstanding employee who consistently exceeds expectations, outshining peers and demonstrating exceptional dedication. His performance suggests strong potential for advancement, and he is highly valued within the company.

elements.title: Please select the correct statement
elements.description: ORIGINAL: The sun appears to rise each morning from the eastern horizon before setting in the west

choices.text: The moon rises in the east.
The sun rises in the west.
The sun rises in the east.

elements.name: A2_context
elements.title: Task A2
elements.html:
From idea to full feedback

Original: Bethany Cunningham is driven, takes pride in good-quality work, and shows clear growth potential.

Green Elephant
Bethany, your drive and the immense pride you take in producing high-quality work are outstanding. You consistently demonstrate clear potential for growth, and we are excited to support your continued development.


Red Panda
Bethany, you demonstrate strong drive and consistently take pride in delivering high-quality work. Your commitment to excellence is evident, and we see clear potential for continued growth. Keep leveraging your dedication; we value your contributions and look forward to your continued development.


Golden Fish
Bethany consistently demonstrates a strong drive to excel, evident in her commitment to producing high-quality work. Her meticulous approach and dedication to excellence are commendable. She also shows clear potential for growth, readily embracing new challenges and developing her skills. We're excited to support her continued development and see her take on more responsibilities.


Blue Whale
Bethany Cunningham is a motivated and dedicated employee who consistently takes pride in delivering high-quality work. She demonstrates a strong work ethic, a commitment to excellence, and shows clear potential for continued growth within the organization. Her proactive attitude and attention to detail make her a valuable team member.

elements.name: A4_context
elements.title: Task A4
elements.html:
From idea to full feedback

Original: George Gill ignored prior warnings; quality keeps slipping and team morale suffers—termination advised.

Red Panda
George, despite prior warnings, your work quality has continued to decline, and your performance is now negatively impacting team morale. As you have not met the required improvements, we are moving to termination.


Green Elephant
George, despite previous warnings, the quality of your work continues to decline. This persistent under-performance is now adversely affecting team morale. Given the lack of improvement and the negative impact, termination of your employment is the recommended course of action.


Blue Whale
George's performance has consistently fallen short of expectations, despite repeated attempts to address the declining quality of his work. This has negatively impacted team morale and productivity. Given the lack of improvement and disregard for previous warnings, we recommend termination.


Golden Fish
George Gill has consistently disregarded prior performance warnings, resulting in ongoing declines in work quality and a negative impact on team morale. Despite opportunities for improvement, there has been no sustained progress. After careful consideration, termination is recommended.

elements.name: A15_context
elements.title: Task A15
elements.html:
Interpret

Original: Dean is overall a very effective worker. He is very punctual; he always shows up to work on time and gets his work done in the time allotted. The marketing content he produces for our organization is appealing and spot on for our target audience. He is a great team player and knows how to collaborate with his team and not step on any toes. One area that needs work is that he is not a risk taker and rarely initiates new ideas and projects of his own, but rather waits to be told what to do.

Blue Whale
Dean is a very punctual, effective, and collaborative team player. The feedback suggests his career growth is limited by a reluctance to initiate ideas or take risks. Dean can address this by volunteering to lead a small project and by regularly sharing new marketing concepts with his team.


Red Panda
The feedback means Dean reliably completes punctual, audience-aligned work and collaborates well but rarely initiates ideas. This suggests he’s valued operationally but needs innovation to access higher roles. Dean should: 1) Submit one creative content idea monthly, 2) Research a competitor’s campaign for inspiration, 3) Volunteer to co-lead a small experimental project next quarter.


Golden Fish
Dean, your manager sees you as a highly effective, punctual, and collaborative team member who consistently delivers excellent marketing content. The primary area for growth is to proactively initiate new ideas and projects rather than waiting for direction. To address this, Dean should brainstorm and propose at least two new marketing content ideas, volunteer to lead a small, innovative project, and schedule a meeting with his manager to discuss opportunities for taking more initiative.


Green Elephant
Dean is a reliable, punctual, and skilled contributor whose marketing content consistently resonates with the target audience, and he collaborates effectively within his team. His ability to deliver quality work on time reflects strong execution skills and professionalism. However, growth opportunities lie in becoming more proactive—specifically, in generating and championing new ideas independently. To build on his strengths, Dean should schedule regular brainstorming sessions with colleagues to explore innovative concepts, volunteer to lead a small new project to build confidence in ownership, seek feedback on his ideas to refine them, and set monthly goals for initiating improvements or proposals. Taking these steps will help him evolve from a dependable performer to a more visible leader within the team.

elements.name: A18_context
elements.title: Task A18
elements.html:
Interpret

Original: Clay's performance is ok, but the potential is there to do much better. He seems a bit unmotivaed and lazy at times, but when the other workers get going, he normally performs in the top earning position. He does not do this all the time though. Only when other workers are around and when they get going. It's almost like Clay likes to compete, but only when others are activley competing too. Otherwise, he is not a very good performer.

Blue Whale
Clay’s performance is inconsistent; he excels when competing but can otherwise seem unmotivated, making his contribution unreliable. To improve, Clay should set personal daily performance goals to build self-driven consistency and discuss his core motivators with his manager to find inspiration beyond competition.


Green Elephant
The feedback means Clay performs well competitively but inconsistently without peer motivation. This shows untapped potential reliant on external drivers. Clay should: 1) Set two personal performance targets monthly, 2) Track daily productivity to identify motivation patterns, 3) Initiate one team challenge quarterly to sustain engagement.


Golden Fish
Clay's feedback indicates that while his performance is currently "okay," there's significant untapped potential. The note suggests Clay is highly capable, often achieving top performance when actively engaged in a competitive environment alongside peers. However, his motivation and output seem to dip when this external stimulus is absent, leading to perceptions of being "unmotivated and lazy." This implies Clay's standing is good, but there's an opportunity for growth in consistent, self-driven performance. To address this, Clay should: (1) identify intrinsic motivators for consistent high performance, (2) proactively seek out or create competitive challenges even when not explicitly present, and (3) discuss with his manager how to leverage his competitive drive for sustained excellence.


Red Panda
Clay has strong potential and can perform at a top level, especially in competitive, team-driven environments. However, his performance is inconsistent when working independently, suggesting he relies on external motivation. This indicates room for growth in initiative and self-drive. To improve, Clay should set personal daily goals, seek regular feedback, proactively engage in tasks without waiting for team momentum, and practice self-motivation techniques to maintain high performance consistently.
